summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2021 between a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) Special Agent and Justin Houston, a Program Manager for Convergint Federal/SigNet Technologies. The OIG is investigating the failure of recording system drives at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in August 2019, which is when Jeffrey Epstein died. The emails discuss the drive failures, the involvement of FBI agents and technicians, and the OIG's request for all related work orders and communications.

keyFacts: The recording system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York suffered a critical failure in August 2019 when two drives failed, the second on August 8th, causing a complete loss of recording capability.
Justin Houston, a contractor for SigNet/Convergint Federal, was brought to the FBI facility in Quantico to analyze the failed drives and had signed a non-disclosure agreement with the FBI.
The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is actively investigating the incident in September 2021, requesting all related work orders and communications for 2019.
FBI Agent Jeff McKenzie and technician Jeff Cranor were involved in working on the case regarding the failed MCC drives.
The timing of the drive failures (August 2019) coincides with the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the MCC and died.
